comments.body: These don't exist on ReactWrapper, only ShallowWrapper.

Should this be a single heterogeneous array type? i.e. `nodes: Array<ReactElement<any> | Array<ReactElement<any>>`
would allow for
```tsx
containsAllMatchingElements([<span />, [<span />, <span />]])
```
Not sure if that's a legit thing that works in enzyme, haven't messed with React 16 much.
I'd be ok with that although was following the method signatures inside of the enzyme lib so that it'd be as close as possible to what they are doing there.

It's possible to write React components with constructors that don't accept props, and the signatures wouldn't match here. Seems this would break overload selection for .find and friends on such components.
